001package ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.capture.libpcap;
002
003import ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.capture.libpcap.cstruct.BpfProgramStruct;
004import ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.capture.libpcap.cstruct.PcapPkthdr;
005import java.nio.file.Path;
006import java.util.Arrays;
007import java.util.Objects;
008import jnr.ffi.Memory;
009import jnr.ffi.Pointer;
010import jnr.ffi.Runtime;
011
012/**
013 * JNR libpcap adapter with zero per-packet heap allocation: uses a per-thread reusable scratch
014 * buffer that grows as needed.
015 */
016public final class JnrPcapAdapter implements Pcap {
017  private final JnrLibpcap p = JnrLibpcap.INSTANCE;
018  private final Runtime rt = Runtime.getSystemRuntime();
019
020  /**
021   * Creates a libpcap adapter using the default JNR bindings.
022   *
023   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
024   */
025  public JnrPcapAdapter() {}
026
027  /**
028   * Opens a live capture handle using libpcap.
029   *
030   * @param iface network interface name
031   * @param snap snap length in bytes
032   * @param promisc whether to enable promiscuous mode
033   * @param timeoutMs poll timeout in milliseconds
034   * @param bufferBytes capture buffer size in bytes
035   * @param immediate whether to enable immediate mode
036   * @return activated {@link PcapHandle}
037   * @throws PcapException if any libpcap call fails
038   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
039   */
040  @Override
041  public PcapHandle openLive(
042      String iface,
043      int snap,
044      boolean promisc,
045      int timeoutMs,
046      int bufferBytes,
047      boolean immediate) throws PcapException {
048    Pointer err = Memory.allocateDirect(rt, 256);
049    Pointer ph = p.pcap_create(iface, err);
050    if (ph == null) {
051      throw new PcapException("pcap_create failed");
052    }
053
054    check(ph, p.pcap_set_snaplen(ph, snap), "pcap_set_snaplen");
055    check(ph, p.pcap_set_promisc(ph, promisc ? 1 : 0), "pcap_set_promisc");
056    check(ph, p.pcap_set_timeout(ph, timeoutMs), "pcap_set_timeout");
057    check(ph, p.pcap_set_buffer_size(ph, bufferBytes), "pcap_set_buffer_size");
058    check(ph, p.pcap_set_immediate_mode(ph, immediate ? 1 : 0), "pcap_set_immediate_mode");
059
060    int rc = p.pcap_activate(ph);
061    if (rc != 0) {
062      throw new PcapException("pcap_activate: " + p.pcap_geterr(ph));
063    }
064
065    return new HandleImpl(ph, rt, p, snap);
066  }
067
068  /**
069   * Opens an offline capture handle using libpcap.
070   *
071   * @param file pcap or pcapng file path
072   * @param snap snap length in bytes used when copying frames
073   * @return activated {@link PcapHandle}
074   * @throws PcapException if the file cannot be opened
075   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
076   */
077  @Override
078  public PcapHandle openOffline(Path file, int snap) throws PcapException {
079    Objects.requireNonNull(file, "file");
080    Pointer err = Memory.allocateDirect(rt, 256);
081    Pointer ph = p.pcap_open_offline(file.toString(), err);
082    if (ph == null || ph.address() == 0) {
083      String message = err.getString(0);
084      if (message == null || message.isBlank()) {
085        message = "unknown error";
086      }
087      throw new PcapException("pcap_open_offline: " + message.strip());
088    }
089    return new HandleImpl(ph, rt, p, snap);
090  }
091
092  /**
093   * No-op for compatibility; live handles must be closed individually.
094   *
095   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
096   */
097  @Override
098  public void close() {}
099
100  /**
101   * Returns the libpcap version string reported by the native library.
102   *
103   * @return libpcap version string
104   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
105   */
106  @Override
107  public String libVersion() {
108    return p.pcap_lib_version();
109  }
110
111  private void check(Pointer ph, int rc, String where) throws PcapException {
112    if (rc != 0) {
113      throw new PcapException(where + ": " + p.pcap_geterr(ph));
114    }
115  }
116
117  /** Concrete handle wrapping a pcap_t*. */
118  private static final class HandleImpl implements PcapHandle {
119    private static final int COPY_CHUNK = 4096;
120    private static final int SCRATCH_INIT = 2048;
121
122    private final Pointer ph;
123    private final Runtime rt;
124    private final JnrLibpcap p;
125    private final int snaplen;
126
127    private final PcapPkthdr H;
128    private final Pointer hdr_pp;
129    private final Pointer data_pp;
130
131    private static final ThreadLocal<byte[]> SCRATCH =
132        ThreadLocal.withInitial(() -> new byte[SCRATCH_INIT]);
133
134    HandleImpl(Pointer ph, Runtime rt, JnrLibpcap p, int snaplen) {
135      this.ph = ph;
136      this.rt = rt;
137      this.p = p;
138      this.snaplen = snaplen > 0 ? snaplen : 65535;
139      this.H = new PcapPkthdr(rt);
140      this.hdr_pp = Memory.allocateDirect(rt, rt.addressSize());
141      this.data_pp = Memory.allocateDirect(rt, rt.addressSize());
142    }
143
144    /**
145     * Applies a BPF filter to the active capture handle.
146     *
147     * @param bpf filter expression; {@code null} or blank removes filtering
148     * @throws PcapException if compilation or installation fails
149     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
150     */
151    @Override
152    public void setFilter(String bpf) throws PcapException {
153      if (bpf == null || bpf.isEmpty()) {
154        return;
155      }
156      var prog = new BpfProgramStruct(rt);
157      int rc = p.pcap_compile(ph, prog, bpf, 1, 0xffffffff);
158      if (rc != 0) {
159        throw new PcapException("pcap_compile: " + p.pcap_geterr(ph));
160      }
161      try {
162        rc = p.pcap_setfilter(ph, prog);
163        if (rc != 0) {
164          throw new PcapException("pcap_setfilter: " + p.pcap_geterr(ph));
165        }
166      } finally {
167        p.pcap_freecode(prog);
168      }
169    }
170
171    /**
172     * Polls libpcap for the next packet and routes it to the callback.
173     *
174     * @param cb callback receiving timestamp (microseconds) and packet bytes
175     * @return {@code true} to continue polling; {@code false} when EOF is reached
176     * @throws PcapException if libpcap signals an error
177     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
178     */
179    @Override
180    public boolean next(Pcap.PacketCallback cb) throws PcapException {
181      int n = p.pcap_next_ex(ph, hdr_pp, data_pp);
182      if (n == 1) {
183        Pointer hdrPtr = hdr_pp.getPointer(0);
184        Pointer pktPtr = data_pp.getPointer(0);
185
186        if (pktPtr == null || pktPtr.address() == 0) {
187          return true;
188        }
189
190        H.useMemory(hdrPtr);
191        long tsMicros = H.ts.tv_sec.longValue() * 1_000_000L + H.ts.tv_usec.longValue();
192
193        int caplen = H.caplen.intValue();
194        if (caplen < 0) {
195          caplen = 0;
196        }
197        if (caplen > snaplen) {
198          caplen = snaplen;
199        }
200
201        byte[] buf = SCRATCH.get();
202        if (buf.length < caplen) {
203          int newLen = buf.length;
204          while (newLen < caplen) {
205            newLen = Math.min(snaplen, Math.max(newLen << 1, caplen));
206          }
207          buf = Arrays.copyOf(buf, newLen);
208          SCRATCH.set(buf);
209        }
210
211        int remaining = caplen;
212        int off = 0;
213        while (remaining > 0) {
214          int chunk = Math.min(remaining, COPY_CHUNK);
215          pktPtr.get(off, buf, off, chunk);
216          remaining -= chunk;
217          off += chunk;
218        }
219
220        cb.onPacket(tsMicros, buf, caplen);
221        return true;
222
223      } else if (n == 0) {
224        return true;
225      } else if (n == -1) {
226        throw new PcapException("pcap_next_ex: " + p.pcap_geterr(ph));
227      } else {
228        return false;
229      }
230    }
231
232    @Override
233    public int dataLink() throws PcapException {
234      int type = p.pcap_datalink(ph);
235      if (type < 0) {
236        throw new PcapException("pcap_datalink: " + p.pcap_geterr(ph));
237      }
238      return type;
239    }
240
241    /**
242     * Releases the underlying {@code pcap_t} handle.
243     *
244     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
245     */
246    @Override
247    public void close() {
248      p.pcap_close(ph);
249    }
250  }
251}
252
